byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: Ed Miliband, who built a campaign strategy of taxation of the rich and added social spending, resigned as the head of Labour after the party’s defeat in elections.

headline.print_headline: Appeal to Dwindling Core Proves Costly for Labour Party in Britain
headline.main: Appeal to Dwindling Core Proves Costly for Labour Party in Britain

snippet: Ed Miliband, who built a campaign strategy of taxation of the rich and added social spending, resigned as the head of Labour after the party’s defeat in elections.
abstract: News Analysis; stinging defeat suffered by Labour Party in Great Britain's elections points to party's failure to connect to voters as its traditional working class base fades; party is left to debate how to rework its central message and appeal to rising nationalism in both England and Scotland.
